title: New Developments on MT at the European Commission

author: Spyridon Pilos, Directorate-General for Translation, European Commission

segmentation: Just heard a presentation by a potential client.
So I mean, I will not say anything about the user needs.
This was explained, but I mean so I'm coming from the European Commission from the Director General for Translation.
We have an informatics unit and informatics unit has a sector dealing with language applications which has an observation Observatory technology observation group.
Let's say which we call language technology what?
I will tell you something about translation in the European Commission machine translation, the European Commission, and about the next steps.
So the Director general for Translation has a staff of almost 1800 linguists and 600 support staff.
It has a production that in 2008 was 2 million pages, did not convert it into words.
It would be impressive, I think.
More impressive.
Probably the cost for the Europe for the translation of the European Commission is 300 million euros here.
But all translation and interpretation.
Services of all day.
You institutions come at a price of two euros a year per citizen.
So up to now, but we're not translating everything.
For example, if you take the website of the European Institution of the European Union oropi DOT EU.
If you want to make it fully multilingual, we should translate almost 6.8 million documents, which means eight 8500 translators working full time for one year.
So there is a challenge.
No, we have a machine translation services.
We had it for four years as European Commission, with currently is managed by my director general for Translation.
It's rule based machine translation technology and has been developed between 1975 and 98 and over all these years.
So we have developed in the eight language pairs.
Covering just 10 languages seems 2000 X A6.
There was a decision that we just continue to work on a voluntary basis by translators.
I mean on maintenance of the dictionary, St.
Dictionary enrichment on a couple of these systems now.
In spite of this, the use of this isn't.
This system has grown from 1.5 million pages in 2006 to 2.5 million pages in 2009, so pages is not the same page as the previous.
It's it.
I mean, even a phrase can be a paid OK just to be fair on the figures.
Now what?
Who is using it and what form you have a you institutions use it is using it, but you also have.
Public bodies in the Member States.
So any public administration can make can apply and have access to this and use it for the existing language person.
This these are used for testing.

We have also online services information systems that use it for Rd translation and this includes, for example, the service on tenders tenders daily that is provided by the European Commission or the internal market information system that is using it for Rd translation.
And did the translation is using it as one more tool to assist computer to assist translation.
The translation process.

In fact, for the existing language pairs its incoming documents is sent simultaneously to the translation memory system and to machine translation, and then both are offered to the translators for the existing land.
Spurs, I repeat.
No.
We were lucky last year because as a chemo said last year, there was a lot of talk about multilingualism policy.
So there was a commute Commission communication policy statement by the Commission on Multilingualism which said that human and automatic translation is important part of multilingualism policy.
Now we took this as a mandate and we have looked at the facts.
The facts were that easy.
Is our current system is rule based and it's very costly to develop.
There are data driven systems there that are cheap and quick to develop.
If you have the data and we have the data.
In fact to give you information our current or latest estimate of the data we have is.
450 million phrases segments, or around 6 billion words.
So we have the data and in all 23 languages.
So.
We have run some tests of commercial and non commercial tools and some tests of empty systems.
In many cases these were as those just mentioned.
Let's say asking translators.
Is it good result or not?
But we are we have progressed in the last recently let's say and where we have used some more standardized testing.
I mean, whether what more widely accepted, I would say.
No.

Last year we have proposed strategy for, but this has been proposed by my director general to the whole of the Commission, and this was led to the creation of a Task Force group having representatives of the different director generals and the main question was first, do we need a machine translation service of the Commission at the time there was no Google because we would ask you or Google Translator.

Enough because this questions, I suppose, come everyday to everybody in this room, almost probably, and so we ask, do we really need something which is internal to the Commission, managed by the Commission?
And how do we go?
Go ahead and build it?
So this was created in November, and by April we had the results and the result.
The conclusion is yes we need.

Machine translation service for the Commission for Reasons of Trust of respecting confidentiality and also for ensuring continuity of service, the European Commission cannot just say if there is a provider there offering a free service.
Now, the provider decides that we stop it and the European Commission cannot offer the service this.
Is not an option.

Then it was considered that data driven systems were in fact a major technological breakthrough in the sense that with the computing power increase in the computer resources that were getting cheaper and cheaper and more and more available, it was possible to implement things that were there have been there for years.
OK, but now it was the right time to start implementing them.
We have collected the user requirements.
And in fact, they can say that the European Patent Office user requirements were represented by the Directorate General for Internal Market information.
So in this this.
For internal market, so I mean it's there to represent it there.
Then we have elaborated in architecture which we want to have the following characteristics flexible, sustainable and ensuring technological independence.
This is how the system would look like.
That is, we separated the customized the custom services part which is on the far right end.
The dispatcher, the service part which is in the center and the data and vantage part which is done on the left.
Right closer to me.
So this we have used basically to structure the discussion into structured organization and financial arrangements.
Becausw we say OK then thing Engine Spark part which includes offering get basic general baseline system for everybody would be funded at the European Commission level.
Then data management is the will be the business of digital and for any customized solutions any client waiting to plug into the system would have to pay their specific.
Product
Object.
Now, in the mean way will we run an internal experimentation with the Moses toolkit using our internal data?
And with temporary redeployment of existing ID and human resources in my unit.
This mistake has cost us nothing on top of the current budget just to translate it into something else.
So active contribution will we had was for the Portuguese language Department, the Euro metrics plus project of course, and the European power.
What we did was we developed in anti to Portuguese engine.
We prepared corpus and cleaned it and we had a human evaluation by more than 30 translators.
What we did not do was do not improve the corpus quality.
We did not improve the language and translation models and we did not make any intervention intervention.

But our first inclusions are that the results of the quality violation were was so encouraging that the Portuguese, the language Department desired, decided to abandon completely the rule based system and focus on developing their statistical machine translation system.

Now we need to do some dedicated analysis of the engineering work required to go to production Ready system for all EU languages and the main competitive advantage of digital data as we see it is the quality of data cleaning just to say here that next with this implementation, that's how we call it Exodus.
You know Pharaoh Moses exodus.
This is that the idea?
That would be an English to French language couple which participates in the evaluation in the 2010 competition in.
Uppsala.
Now the next thing we do is we put the pieces together.
An action plan has been developed and it's currently being District discussed internally in the Commission.

We need to develop a governance structure so that everybody knows what we're doing and that the user requirement needs are represented correctly, both for the service for the whole of the Commission, but also for the service internally in the in the translation.
As language service provider let's say well everything will be set out concretely, we started already working on data in preparation of the we start we will start soon.
They don't work on data preparation for the data hub but the key talents and then we cannot find any replies yet.
It's hard to compare alternative systems, both commercial and non commercial in terms of quality of output price, meaning total cost of ownership.

Feasibility of implementing in our own system and also language coverage and just the last phrase as we talk about data, but in parallel the Commission is preparing to continuously update the multilingual translation memory that is available on the day I joined Research Center website.
This is will be available in 23 languages and this means all legislation that will be published by EU will be.
Uploaded in a way more or less automatically in regular intervals on on the Internet to be used by by researchers in Publix and this we hope to do it in autumn 2002.
Thank you very much.
Thank you Steven for this very interesting talk and we learned a lot if not enough.
There are questions.
Yeah, I may have the same question as to the previous speaker.
What is the relationship between machine translation, automatic machine translation and translator?
Do they accept easily the fact that some machine comes to replace their work or do what they cannot do with the simple question is no.
No translator accepts easily that the machine can do his work or her work.
I mean the because the machine cannot do his work or her work, but on the other hand.
You may have noticed that we changed the issue from an issue for translation to an issue for multilingual communication.
That is where developer we tried to develop a service so that the Commission can communicate beauty.
Lingually translators can use it benefit from it, but I don't think it will be the main benefit from the system.
The main benefit will be that there will be more.
Content available in more languages.
OK now of course.
Sorry it's not correct.
More content accessible in more languages not available for the available content meant languages.
I think that will be still translators who will translate because it has to be official content.
OK, thank you.
Three questions.
Yes, yes or no.
Strictly rule based.
OK. How much money is it?
How big is your problem collaborating with?
First, where?
The idea that we must be flexible in technology, technological independent means that we take whatever is works best for its language, pair and for its use.
This is our link with people.
If you want indirectly with any clients that could require specific.
Domain related engines, etc.
In terms of funding the funding, I mean, as I told you last year that time there was not even strategy.
So this year we have the action plan which goes with part of funding.
But we are trying to use the available funding.
That is, we're working with Euro metrics plus OK, it's funding as well.
We hope that we will work with let's empty for setting up a system.
They were working with the.
What's the project?
I don't remember it now.
It's a project on data, not floormat floor, and it is the network we are working on Flare Nut but there is a. Yeah, I don't remember it now.
Shortly we're working on reaching into data studies to improve data show, and we're trying to benefit from the needs of others.
So if there is the activity in a Commission Department that is relevant for the whole of the Commission, we want to benefit touch.
Why were working with the publication's office, let's say or with the internal market?
OK, if they have experience we want to share it.
So it's money that is already spent that well.
Trying to use optimal.
No worries, thank you very much again.
